abstract.text: Minimizes an 8-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved buffer.

inlineContent.text: The source vImage buffer.
A pointer to the destination vImage buffer structure. You’re responsible for filling out the
, and

fields of this structure, and for allocating a data buffer of the appropriate size. On return, the data buffer this structure points to contains the destination image data. When you no longer need the data buffer, deallocate the memory to prevent memory leaks.
A pointer to a temporary buffer. If you pass

, the function allocates the buffer and then deallocates it before returning. Alternatively, you can allocate the buffer yourself, in which case you’re responsible for deallocating it when you no longer need it.
The horizontal offset, in pixels, to the upper-left pixel of the region of interest within the source image.
The vertical offset, in pixels, to the upper-left pixel of the region of interest within the source image.
The height of the kernel in pixels. This value must be odd.
The width of the kernel in pixels. This value must be odd.
The options to use when performing the operation. If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass
; otherwise, pass
To specify that the function doesn’t apply the operation to the alpha channel, set the
flag.
To determine the minimum size for the temporary buffer, set the
flag.
; otherwise, one of the error codes described in
The minimize filter is an optimized version of the erosion in which all the filter elements are zero.
If you want to allocate the memory for the
parameter yourself, call this function twice, as follows:
To determine the minimum size for the temporary buffer, the first time you call this function, pass the

flag. Pass the same values for all other parameters that you intend to use for the second call. The function returns the required minimum size, which should be a positive value (a negative returned value indicates an error). The
flag prevents the function from performing any processing other than to determine the minimum buffer size.
After you allocate enough space for a buffer of the returned size, call the function a second time, passing a valid pointer in the
parameter. This time, don’t pass the
flag.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Simulate a bokeh effect by applying dilation.

doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation.title: Adding a bokeh effect to images

abstract.text: A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
A flag that returns the minimum temporary buffer size for the operation, given the parameters provided.
A flag that restricts the operation to red, green, and blue channels only.
The vImage function completed without error.
A flag that sets the behavior to the default.
Minimizes an 8-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved buffer.
Minimizes an 8-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved buffer.
Minimizes an 8-bit planar buffer.
Minimizes a 32-bit planar buffer.
A type for the number of pixels.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
The height of the image, in pixels.
The distance, in bytes, between the start of one pixel row and the next in an image, including any unused space between them.
The width of the image, in pixels.
A type for image errors.
A type for processing options.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
